intro: Parakeelya strophiolata, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Parakeelya strophiolata is a hardy shrub that thrives in a variety of soil types and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
